repository.note: There is no default package repository, this should be implied either from the namespace or using a repository base URL as repository_url qualifiers key.

namespace_definition.note: The namespace is the vendor of the package. It is not case sensitive and must be lowercased.

name_definition.note: The name is the package name.

version_definition.note: The version is the package version.

qualifiers_definition.description: Base URL for the package repository

steps.question: Is there a vendor component?
steps.yes: Extract the vendor (first component after pkg:qpkg/)
steps.no: Invalid PURL - vendor is required for qpkg

steps.question: Is there a package name component?
steps.yes: Extract the package name (component after vendor/)
steps.no: Invalid PURL - name is required for qpkg

steps.question: Is there a version component?
steps.no: Invalid PURL - version is required for qpkg

context.naming_convention: Dot-separated package names with vendor prefix
context.repository_model: Distributed with no central default repository

edge_cases.handling: Versions include timestamps and build identifiers
edge_cases.purl_impact: Preserves complete version information including timestamps

edge_cases.handling: Use repository_url qualifier to specify non-default repository
edge_cases.purl_impact: Allows disambiguation when same package exists in multiple repositories

do_not_assume: QNX packages don't require a vendor
Package names can contain uppercase letters
There is a default repository URL
key_facts_to_remember: Vendor is required and must be lowercase
Package name is required and uses dot notation

Version format is specific to QNX
common_mistakes_to_avoid: Using uppercase letters in vendor name
Forgetting to include the vendor component
Using standard version formats instead of QNX format
